summary: This is a sworn statement transcript from a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with Federal Bureau of Prisons Captain Kim, conducted on October 27, 2021. The interview focuses on allegations that Correctional Officer Tova Noel was instructed to falsify training documents (specifically SHU quarterly training and suicide prevention training) without actually receiving the training. Captain Kim denies these allegations, stating she only informed Noel of the training requirement and that the SHU lieutenant was responsible for administering it. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, touching on training protocols and staff conduct at MCC New York.

connections.description: Kim, as administrative lieutenant, was involved in scheduling and managing Noel's leave and training requirements. Noel considered Kim her supervisor during her injury leave.
Noel was a correctional officer at MCC New York where Epstein was held. The interview investigates training failures that could relate to Epstein's supervision.
Epstein was celled with inmate Tartaglione in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, following a psychology directive.

keyFacts: Captain Kim, a BOP administrator, denies under oath instructing CO Tova Noel to falsify training documents in June 2019.
Tova Noel alleged under oath that Kim directly asked her to sign SHU and suicide prevention training sign-in sheets without providing the training, citing pressure for a program review.
The interview reveals a direct contradiction between two sworn statements regarding potential document falsification at MCC New York.
The investigation is part of the broader OIG probe into the death of Jeffrey Epstein, examining institutional failures and staff conduct.
Kim states that the SHU lieutenant was responsible for administering the training and having staff sign the sheets, and that she only scheduled the training and maintained records.
